member_organisations:
http://iogt.org/about-iogt/members/ 
 
IOGT International currently has 151 Member Organizations from 60 countries worldwide. 
In Europe, IOGT International has 59 Member Organizations from 25 countries.
fields_of_interest: Agriculture, Culture and media, Budget, Trade, Competition, Culture, International co-operation and development, Customs, Education and training, Employment and Social Affairs, Taxation, Youth, Justice and Fundamental Rights, Single market, Regional Policy, External Relations, Public Health, Borders and Security
eu_initiatives: IOGT International follows the EU's initiatives in public health, trade, internal market, fundament rights, social and employment policy, agriculture and international aid - both as these policy areas pertain to activities of the European Commission and the European Parliament.
subsection: Non-governmental organisations, platforms and networks and similar
goals__remit: IOGT International’s vision is a life for all human beings free to live up to their fullest potential, and free from harm caused by alcohol and other drugs. It’s a world of peace, democracy and justice where free and healthy citizens actively contribute in all levels of society.
relevant_communication:
IOGT International’s mission is to unite, strengthen and empower civil society to tackle alcohol and other drugs as serious obstacles to development on personal, community, societal and global level. 
IOGT International advocates comprehensive and evidence-based solutions consisting of public policy measures as well as scientific research, prevention, education and awareness raising, capacity building and treatment and rehabilitation.
